title.narrative: Practical tools for poultry diseases detection and control.

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award From August 21-25, 2017, APHIS conducted a training course on practical tools for poultry diseases detection and control. The program aimed to strengthen the capacity of laboratory technicians and field epidemiologists on the mastery of poultry diseases surveillance and diagnosis tools and promoted the development and implementation of biosecurity procedures in poultry farms and live birds markets. Laboratory technicians and field epidemiologists from 6 countries attended. The countries included Cameroon; Central African Republic; Chad; Congo (Brazzaville); Congo, Democratic Republic of; and Gabon. The content of the workshop included updates and discussions on major poultry diseases, countries experiences, practical tools for surveillance and laboratory diagnosis of poultry diseases and the concepts and procedures of biosecurity in poultry farms & live birds markets. The workshop also provided practical sessions including: visits to a poultry farm and a live bird market, clinical examination of birds, sampling and autopsy and conduct of laboratory diagnostic tests: HA & IHA for NCD & AI, Bacteriology for Salmonella detection and Results interpretation..
